content: Daily Offerings(A)
Now the  spoke to Moses, saying,
“Command the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘My offering, My food for My offerings made by fire as a sweet aroma to Me, you shall be careful to offer to Me at their appointed time.’
“And you shall say to them, ‘This  the offering made by fire which you shall offer to the : two male lambs in their first year without blemish, day by day, as a regular burnt offering.
The one lamb you shall offer in the morning, the other lamb you shall offer in the evening,
and one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a grain offering mixed with one-fourth of a hin of pressed oil.
a regular burnt offering which was ordained at Mount Sinai for a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the .
And its drink offering  one-fourth of a hin for each lamb; in a holy  you shall pour out the drink to the  as an offering.
The other lamb you shall offer in the evening; as the morning grain offering and its drink offering, you shall offer  as an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the .
Sabbath Offerings
‘And on the Sabbath day two lambs in their first year, without blemish, and two-tenths  of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, with its drink offering—
the burnt offering for every Sabbath, besides the regular burnt offering with its drink offering.
Monthly Offerings
‘At the beginnings of your months you shall present a burnt offering to the : two young bulls, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year, without blemish;
three-tenths  of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, for each bull; two-tenths  of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, for the one ram;
and one-tenth  of fine flour, mixed with oil, as a grain offering for each lamb, as a burnt offering of sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the .

Their drink offering shall be half a hin of wine for a bull, one-third of a hin for a ram, and one-fourth of a hin for a lamb; this  the burnt offering for each month throughout the months of the year.
Also one kid of the goats as a sin offering to the  shall be offered, besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
Offerings at Passover(L)
‘On the fourteenth day of the first month  the Passover of the .
And on the fifteenth day of this month  the feast; unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days.
On the first day  a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work.
And you shall present an offering made by fire as a burnt offering to the : two young bulls, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year. Be sure they are without blemish.
Their grain offering shall be of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths  you shall offer for a bull, and two-tenths for a ram;
you shall offer one-tenth  for each of the seven lambs;
also one goat  a sin offering, to make atonement for you.
You shall offer these besides the burnt offering of the morning, which  for a regular burnt offering.
In this manner you shall offer the food of the offering made by fire daily for seven days, as a sweet aroma to the ; it shall be offered besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
And on the seventh day you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work.
Offerings at the Feast of Weeks(S)
‘Also on the day of the firstfruits, when you bring a new grain offering to the  at your  Weeks, you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work.
You shall present a burnt offering as a sweet aroma to the : two young bulls, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year,
with their grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths  for each bull, two-tenths for the one ram,
and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs;
one kid of the goats, to make atonement for you.
Be sure they are without blemish. You shall present  with their drink offerings, besides the regular burnt offering with its grain offering.
